text: well we know that it was an enormous
undertaking a happened last Sunday in
the dawn hours around 4:00 a.m. and you
had about 3,000 police and law
enforcement officers they were
accompanied by many specially trained
dogs and they were backed up by
helicopters and boats because they were
sweeping into a seaside village and
their aim was to eliminate what
officials called the region's number-one
drugs village of for sure officials said
that this village alone accounted for
more than 1/3 of China's total supply of
crystal meth and the estimate is that
more than one in five people in this
village about fourteen thousand people
were involved in this industry now for
those people who are unfamiliar with it
crystal meth is the street name for a
highly addictive a stimulant drug it's
not grown it's actually manufactured in
a laboratory and this village has been
making crystal meth for a number of
years there used to be famous for
producing lai cheese a very sweet
Asian fruit but local media has been
saying that because of the this drugs
industry that's taken hold the last few
years that the that the land will no
longer grow these light cheese you
